title: Poland's great economic catch-up, 20 years after accession to the European Union
summary: Despite a certain amount of Euroscepticism in politics and some people being left behind, the country has recovered thanks to European funds and the single market. However, the next two decades are likely to be more difficult.

title: New Caledonia: Emmanuel Macron's ultimatum strategy
summary: As with the pension reform and the immigration law, the head of state uses the same approach in the New Caledonian issue: control the schedule and set a negotiation deadline. While effective in business, this tactic creates distrust and divisions in politics.

title: UN halts all food distribution in Rafah due to lack of supplies
summary: The main United Nations agency for Palestinian refugees, UNRWA, announced on Tuesday the suspension of distribution in Rafah in a post on X without elaborating.

title: Israel to return video equipment seized from Associated Press
summary: Israel reversed its decision to shut down an Associated Press live video feed from war-torn Gaza on Tuesday, after protests from the US news agency and concerns from the White House.

title: After the death of the Iranian president, Tehran faces a double challenge
summary: The Islamic Republic must put forward a possible replacement for Ebrahim Raisi in the elections scheduled for June 28 and also assess options for the succession of the 85-year-old Supreme Leader since the late president was in contention.

title: Cannes 2024: David Cronenberg's 'The Shrouds' explores life and death
summary: At 81, the Canadian director created a film of ethereal beauty, where the protagonist (Vincent Cassel) follows the day-by-day decomposition of his wife's body.

title: Macron will make surprise visit to New Caledonia amid riots
summary: A government spokeswoman announced that the French president will leave on Tuesday evening in an attempt to soothe raging tempers and protests in the French territory.

title: Gérard Depardieu reportedly involved in physical altercation with photographer
summary: According to Italian media, well-known Italian paparazzi photographer Rino Barillari accused the French film star of punching him three times in the face when he tried to photograph him.

title: Cannes 2024: 'The Apprentice,' the rise of Donald Trump from the deriding gaze of Ali Abbasi
summary: The Danish filmmaker returns to the beginnings of the former US president's career, drawing a portrait of a tycoon in the making, caught up in the world of reality TV.

title: Israel-Hamas war: ICC prosecutor requests arrest warrants for both Netanyahu and Hamas leaders
summary: In Israel, the International Criminal Court's decision to equate its government with the Islamist movement provoked strong condemnation, while the Palestinians saw it as recognition of the suffering of the people of Gaza.

title: 'Restricting TikTok in New Caledonia cannot be deemed necessary or proportionate'
summary: Stefania Di Stefano, a specialist in international law, warns of the weak legal basis for blocking the mobile app in the archipelago. This measure is 'unprecedented in France.'

title: Welcome to the Australian outback, the land of Mad Max
summary: For 'Furiosa,' the fifth installment screened out of competition at Cannes, George Miller returned to Silverton, a former mining town turned pilgrimage site for fans after it was the location for the second film in the Mad Max franchise.

title: Pixar lays off 14% of its staff to 'focus on feature films'
summary: The Disney-owned studio is reportedly retreating from making content for streaming following the catastrophic releases of 'Lightyear' and 'Elemental.'

title: China slams Lai's inauguration speech and warns Taiwan of reprisals
summary: China on Tuesday called the inauguration speech of Taiwan's new president Lai Ching-te a 'confession of Taiwan independence,' and warned it would take 'countermeasures.'

title: EU and Moldova sign 'security and defense' partnership
summary: The European Union said similar agreements with other 'selected partners' were also currently in the works.

title: Climate change victims file suit against TotalEnergies and its shareholders
summary: Three days before the group's AGM, eight individuals and three associations are suing the oil giant for 'involuntary manslaughter' and 'endangering others.'

title: One dead, 71 injured after London-Singapore flight hits severe turbulence
summary: The plane apparently plummeted for a number of minutes before it was diverted to Bangkok, where emergency crews rushed to help injured passengers amid stormy weather.

title: Spain 'definitively' recalls ambassador to Argentina after Milei calls Sanchez's wife 'corrupt'
summary: The Argentinian president refused to apologize after labelling the Spanish prime minister's wife as 'corrupt' at a conference in Spain last weekend.
